EXTRACTED VALUE: The controls are indeed a dream, effectively putting to rest the notion that a strategy game can't work on a console. [Aug 2008, p.70]
Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six: Vegas 2 is a great game. It captures the Rainbow Six ‘feel' and delivers high intensity gameplay both on and offline.
Those realistic touches finally makes this the game we knew next-gen Madden could be, burying all memories of target-video snafus. [Oct 2007, p.90]
Prey has a great storyline, although it seems basic at first. It’s innovative, looks gorgeous, and is extremely fun to play.
The graphics are unsurpassed and absolutely stunning. Sound and music quality are professional grade.
A wonderfully crafted videogame that chooses to retrace fonder times should shame the critics into waves of apology.
UT 3 still offers fast and furious action like few others, and 360 sci-fi shooter fans finally have a reason to take a break from "Halo 3."
If you ever played ping-pong a day in your life, you will have instant respect for this title. I just wish it had more depth to it.
Comes surprisingly close to being perfect. When the game flows, the action is really sweet. The stealthy parts are much less enjoyable. [Dec 2005]
NHL 08 is the kind of makeover that this series has been waiting for for years.
Pure fun, nice graphics and a good sound go side by side with a charming gameplay.
Brutal, shocking, gruesome - a horrific adventure let down by iffy level design. [Apr 2008, p.78]
Despite a range of flaws both large and small, DiRT remains a worthy purchase for racing fans.
On its own merits it’s a fantastic cinematic achievement and exceptional precedent for license-based games.
For those of you who are looking for a racing game that does not require Skip Barber's Driving School to understand, MW will prove to be a good fit.
An entirely new land to explore AND some of the most original environments in an Elder Scrolls game? Yes, please.
